thread.title: The Victorian-era matricide case which fascinates Kate Summerscale
thread.title_full: The Victorian-era matricide case which fascinates Kate Summerscale

title: The Victorian-era matricide case which fascinates Kate Summerscale
text:
The Victorian-era matricide case which fascinates Kate Summerscale Share MP3 available 23.42 MB 
Kate Summerscale's obsession with Victorian history recently led her to a chilling true story. 
In the summer of 1895, 13-year-old Robert Coombes went on a spree with his little brother across London. 
Over the course of ten days, the boys went to the cricket at Lords, to the theatre and the seaside. 
Meanwhile their mother was lying dead upstairs in the family home. 
Kate followed the sensational trial that followed, and the second act of the Robert Coombes' life, which led him to Australia. 

The Wicked Boy by Kate Summerscale is published by Bloomsbury. Duration: 51min 5sec Broadcast: Mon 27 Feb 2017, 11:00am Published: Tue 21 Feb 2017, 3:53am Guests
